CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 9, 1972, pg. 1 reads: "Prison Strike - Some 40 demonstrators marched at Western Penitentiary in support of a statewide prison work stoppage. By the court of the state Bureau of Correction, some 1000 prisoners went on strike Sept. 5 at 3 institutions including 150 at Western Penitentiary.  The strike is to dramatize a list of 41 grievances dealing with prison conditions and policies...Others (right) chose to picket near the front gate on Doer Street.-Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Men, women, and children protesting with signs reading "Stop Police Brutality" and "Prisons Big Business at Prisoner's Expense," gathered at gate to Western Penitentiary, Doer Street
